data.title: Programs – Nevada City Film Festival
data.text:
We love short films for their unique ability to provide a glimpse into a much larger world, story or concept. With nothing to lose, short filmmakers are willing to take chances in voice and style. Their films are usually more experimental, more creative, with messages that are more liberated. In keeping with our past shorts programs, we continue to defy genre and categorization, rather finding the threads that weave common stories of the human experience together to create spellbinding experiences for you the viewer to behold.

EID MUBARAK

United States, Live Action

Dir. Mahnoor Euceph, 2022, 15 min

In Urdu with English subtitles

It’s a beautiful candy-colored world, but nothing could be further from this Pakistani girl’s mind as she embarks on a crafty mission to save her beloved pet goat from being eaten on the Muslim holiday of Eid al-Ahza.

THE DANCE

Colombia, Live Action

Dir. Pedro Pablo Vega Reyes, 2021, 15 min

In Spanish with English subtitles

Andrés has a big, big toe problem: his right shoe has a huge hole in it. Normally, that wouldn’t be an issue, but the school dance is tomorrow and he’s got his crush Mariana to impress!

GUGU NAGOGO

Australia, Live Action

Dir. Taku Mbduzi, 2022, 20 min

In English and Shona with English subtitles

When a lunar eclipse stops her late-night letter exchanges, 12-year-old astronomer Gugu must find a way to reconnect with her beloved Gogo (grandmother) who lives far away in Zimbabwe.

Family dynamics are full of twists and turns, just like our lineup of films that blend heartwarming moments with stories of great resilience. From a trio of balding brothers on a quest for hair to a young Ojibwe photographer keeping a sacred fire alive for his father in the afterlife, these stories offer a glimpse into the complexities of our most intimate relationships where love and loss inevitably intersect. (TRT 118)
